questions.question: He appears to be very ……………………… today.
questions.description: Appear is a copular verb. We use adjectives, not adverbs, to modify copular verbs.

questions.question: She doesn’t want to continue her studies. It ……………………. a pity.
questions.description: Seem can be used to talk about subjective impressions and feelings. Appear is mainly used to talk about objective facts.

questions.question: She seems ………………………… an attitude problem.
questions.description: We use a to-infinitive after seem.

questions.question: I hope …………………………. a good job soon.
questions.description: We use a to-infinitive after hope.

questions.question: It is not easy ………………………… smoking.
questions.description: We use a to-infinitive after easy.

questions.question: I suggest ……………………………. a lawyer.
questions.description: Suggest can be followed by an ing form or a that-clause. It cannot be followed by a to-infinitive.

questions.question: The doctor recommended …………………………… down on my sugar intake.
questions.description: After recommend you can write an ing form or a that-clause. You cannot write a to-infinitive.

questions.question: The doctor recommended …………………….. a long break.
questions.description: After recommend you can write an ing form or a that-clause. You cannot write a to-infinitive.

questions.question: The boy insisted ………………………….. nothing wrong.
questions.description: We use a that-clause after insist.

questions.question: Now that I am getting older, I tend ………………………. things.
questions.description: We use a to-infinitive after tend.

questions.question: Let’s cut it ………………………..
questions.description: Here short is the complement of the object it. Object complements are usually adjectives or nouns.

questions.question: I find her attitude …………………………
questions.description: Here strange is the complement of the object attitude. Object complements are usually adjectives or nouns.
